title: Fragment, 17th–18th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: damask, discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Fragment of green silk damask brocaded in gold and rose. Symmetrically entwined foliage, grotesque figures and a tower.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 17th–18th century.
17th–18th century. Medium: silk
Technique: damask, discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade). Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-56-16.
